RAB-0015_syn_2: OPERATIVE SUMMARY: The patient, a 60-year-old female, underwent Monarch robotic bronchoscopy for a left lower lobe nodule. Navigation to the superior segment was successful. Radial EBUS id[REDACTED] an eccentric 17 mm lesion. Augmented fluoroscopy confirmed alignment; CBCT was not required. Biopsies and a brushing were collected. The patient remained stable throughout.

RAB-0015: PATIENT: [REDACTED] 15, 60-year-old female. MRN: [REDACTED]. INDICATION FOR OPERATION: 60-year-old woman with 1.7 cm left lower lobe superior segment nodule and mild hilar adenopathy, undergoing Monarch robotic bronchoscopy for parenchymal sampling. PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Left lower lobe pulmonary nodule. POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Same. PROCEDURE: Robotic navigational bronchoscopy using Monarch platform (CPT 31627), radial EBUS (CPT 31654), transbronchial lung biopsy (CPT 31628), transbronchial brushing (CPT 31623). Under general anesthesia with ETT, CT-based plan was loaded and registration completed. The robotic catheter and sheath were advanced to the LLL superior segment; radial EBUS showed an eccentric 17 mm lesion. Augmented fluoroscopy was used to refine alignment, and CBCT was not required. Several forceps biopsies and a brushing were obtained; bleeding was minimal. The patient remained hemodynamically stable and was discharged after observation.
